thread.title: RAF workman, 42, filmed stealing 1000mph TORNADO fuel | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: RAF workman, 42, filmed stealing 1000mph TORNADO fuel | Daily Mail Online

author: Joseph Curtis For Mailonline
title: RAF workman, 42, filmed stealing 1000mph TORNADO fuel | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share 'It appears that his involvement was much greater, he had been doing it for a couple of years. 'His police interview covered a shorter period of two months, between September and November last year.' The fuel was used in RAF Tornado fighters, pictured, which can reach speeds of 1,000mph (file picture) Coakley's vehicles were handed over to Her Majesty's Revenue and Customs, including a seven and a half ton lorry, after he dodged paying tax - making a total loss of £4,500. Ruth Johnson, defending Coakley, said: 'He made a full and frank admission and admitted that it was on and off and not a regular occurrence. 'He is a civil individual now. He is not employed by RAF Marham and is no longer with his partner. 'This incident has put him significantly out of pocket.' Coakley took the expensive substance while working at RAF Marham base, pictured, in west Norfolk Chair of the bench, Simmy Potter, gave jobless Coakley a 12-month community order and ordered him to undertake 50 hours unpaid work. He was also ordered to pay an £85 victim surcharge and £85 costs. Coakley is living off income he receives from rental properties he owns, the court heard. The swing wing Tornado is a veteran of RAF strikes against enemy forces in bitter wars in Iraq, Afghanistan, Libya and Syria. Entering frontline service back in 1980, the versatile warplane can hit 1,000mph, or 1.3 mach, and climb to a maximum altitude of 50,000ft. Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
